meanings.definition: To march in the opposite direction to a previous march.
meanings.sent1: During the drill, the soldiers practiced countermarching to improve their coordination.
meanings.sent2: The army unit had to countermarch back to their base after realizing they went the wrong way.
meanings.sent3: The penguins decided to try countermarching just for fun, causing a comical chaos on the ice.
meanings.sent4: In the dance routine, the performers countermarched gracefully, creating a mesmerizing visual effect.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized swimmers showcased their skills by countermarching in perfect harmony.

meanings.definition: A movement in which troops march in opposite directions.
meanings.sent1: The countermarching of the two battalions created a striking display on the parade ground.
meanings.sent2: The general ordered the countermarching of the soldiers to confuse the enemy forces.
meanings.sent3: During the military exercise, the countermarching of the platoons led to a humorous mix-up.
meanings.sent4: The countermarching of the regiments symbolized the conflicting ideologies within the army.
meanings.sent5: The sound of countermarching echoed through the valley, signaling the approach of two opposing forces.
